    Lëtz Cybersecurity Challenge 2020
    3rd and 4th April 2020

    You are a student or a professional and passionate by hacking?
    Don't miss this adventure!

    register here

    Lëtz Cybersecurity Challenge

    The Luxembourg Cybersecurity Challenge is organized by C3, the Cybersecurity Competence Center Luxembourg

    This competition targets open-minded creative digital natives. Our aim is not only to find talents but encourage young people to pursue a career in cybersecurity and related disciplines.

    With over 20 unique challenges on the day, we have tasks and activities to keep participants entertained. Participants have to solve security related tasks from domains such as web security, network security, wireless and IoT security, cryptography, exploitation, reverse engineering, forensics, puzzles, trivia and much more.
    So if you enjoy solving challenges, coding, security, IT or just having fun then Lëtz Cybersecurity Challenge is for you.

    Furthermore, through CSCL, we promote safe online behaviors by raising awareness on information security issues as well as develop expertise and interest in cybersecurity through challenging games and skill tests.

    This is for IT experts only, right?

    Actually NO. Some challenges will clearly require IT skills. But we believe that IT security can only be tackled by employing complementary skills.

    The challenges

    The Lëtz Cybersecurity Challenge provides up to 30 challenges in the categories:
    • web app security
    • reverse engineering
    • crypto & stegano
    • forensics
    • network security
    • wireless (hertzian)
    • explotation
    • arduino
    • mobile

    The adventure continues..

    You are < 25 years, student or professional, LU native or resident?
    You might be selected to be part of Lëtz Cybersecuirty team to represent the Grand Duchy at the European Cybersecurity Challenge in Vienna (A), 03 -07 November, 2020.

    The preselection for the Lëtz Cybersecurity Challenge Team 2020 will be revealed at the end of the competition.

    Privacy Policy


    by SECURITYMADEIN.LU — Published on Oct 26, 2018 - v1

    Your trust is important to us, and we take privacy and security very, very seriously. If you have any questions or concerns about our privacy policy or our use of data, please get in touch with us

    • via mail: info@securitymadein.lu,
    • via telephone: +352 274 00 98 601,
    • or via mail: SECURITYMADEIN.LU, 16 Boulevard d'Avranches, L-1160 Luxembourg.

    SECURITYMADEIN.LU will act as the data controller of the Cyber Security Challenge website, since we are the ones determining the means and purposes of the prossessing activities.

    We will never share your information with parties outside SECURITYMADEIN.LU, unless we have explicitly made you aware that we will before you give it to us.

    Analytics

    Cyber Security Challenge website does NOT use any Web analytics systems.

    Security

    When you are surfing our website, we might collect and process web server logs, including IP addresses, user-agents, URLs, date and time logs. We collect those logs for our legitimate interest as these logs enable the security of our website.

    External links

    We might host some links towards third parties websites. Accessing the resources through those links implies your acceptance of their own privacy policies. At least be aware that we cannot be held responsible for what other people do online on their own websites.
